page.title: 11H/MERSEY CONSERVATION AREA
page.content: Most of the 86 houses were built in the 19th century to house people from the nearby Bleach works by the River Mersey. By the early 1970's the area was in parts in a state of disrepair.Plans were being made which could have partially destroyed the buildings and roads. However, a scheme involving the local Authority, the Goverment and Unemployed people in the Community Enterprise Programme produced a dramatic improvment. Only Â£40,000 was provided in 1982 for the scheme but by reusing old setts and other materials the cost was kept down.New skills were learnt by the workers and now almost complete,the area is a fine example of Conservation.
